title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate real GDP per capita for Nojosea for Year 2 as $40, does not calculate real GDP per capita for Oceanville for Year 2 as $20, and/or does not show the work.

( Nominal GDP GDP Deflator ×100 )÷Population=( $960 120 ×100 )÷20=$40 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6EFC@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Nojosea has the higher money supply in Year 2 and/or does not explain that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Nojosea has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Nojosea has the higher money supply.

The response states that Nojosea has the higher money supply in Year 2 and explains that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Nojosea has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Nojosea has the higher money supply.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the inflation rate in Nojosea in Year 2 as 20%, does not calculate the inflation rate in Oceanville in Year 2 as 40%, and/or does not show the work.

Year 2 GDP Deflator−Year 1 GDP Deflator Year 1 GDP Deflator ×100= 120−100 100 ×100=20% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8166@

Year 2 GDP Deflator−Year 1 GDP Deflator Year 1 GDP Deflator ×100= 140−100 100 ×100=40% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@816A@

The response calculates the inflation rate in Nojosea in Year 2 as 20%, calculates the inflation rate in Oceanville in Year 2 as 40%, and shows the work.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Nojosea experienced the higher real interest rate and/or does not explain that Nojosea had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

The response states that Nojosea experienced the higher real interest rate and explains that Nojosea had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the long-run economic growth rate will decrease in Oceanville and/or does not explain that by allocating more resources to the production of consumer goods, capital formation will decrease, leading to less future production and consumption.

The response states that the long-run economic growth rate will decrease in Oceanville and explains that by allocating more resources to the production of consumer goods, capital formation will decrease, leading to less future production and consumption.
